newsitem.title: SLOVAKIA: Slovak SAX extends downtrend in illiquid trading.
newsitem.headline: Slovak SAX extends downtrend in illiquid trading.

text.p: The Slovak SAX index continued to decline on Thursday and dealers said further falls and low liquidity were likely to charcterise trading for the rest of the summer.
The 16-share index fell 3.47 points to close at 177.64, with only 495 share traded on the Bratislava Stock Exchange's (BSE) main listed floor.
"The decline is fuelled mainly by fears of a Slovak crown devaluation, but also the start of a listless summer season seems to be playing a role," said Dusan Sykora of ING Barings.
Sykora said he did not expect a reversal of the downtrend or a significant improvement in market liquidity in the next two months.
"The index might not significantly fall further, but in a wider perspective, the downtrend will be still visible at least by the end of the summer," he said.
Slovnaft fell 50 crowns to close at 850 on Thursday, while VSZ increased one crown to 611.

Overall, volume rose to 299,298 shares, boosted by 284,487 stocks matched in direct trades, from 290,746 shares traded on Wednesday. Turnover fell to 185.69 million crowns from 202.75 million on Wednesday.
